title: Circular coloring
summary: In graph theory, circular coloring is a kind of coloring that may be viewed as a refinement of the usual graph coloring. The circular chromatic number of a graph G {\displaystyle G} , denoted Ï‡ c ( G ) {\displaystyle \chi _{c}(G)} can be given by any of the following definitions, all of which are equivalent (for finite graphs).
